name: Specimens and Stories: A Visit to Natural History Collections

location.name: National Centre for Biological Sciences
location.address: National Centre for Biological Sciences, Bangalore

description:
How are specimens collected, preserved, and studied?

Join us at the Natural History Collections at NCBS and discover the fascinating world of specimens. This visit will be an opportunity to see how scientists collect, preserve, and study specimens that help us understand the story of our planet’s biodiversity. From pressed plants and drawers full of insects to preserved bird specimens, every item offers clues about biodiversity, evolution, and environmental change. Participants will also learn how these collections support research, education, and conservation, and hear the stories behind them.

name: Translating Science into Impact: Our PCR Innovation Story (tentative title)
description:
How have innovations in molecular biology changed our lives?

Sometimes it can be difficult to directly connect modern scientific discovery to its real world impacts. Chandrsekhar Nair will bridge this gap by leading the audience through the story of how a deep understanding of molecular biology and PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) technology led to innovative solutions with tangible outcomes. Through his lecture he highlights how essential it is to translate science into innovation.

name: Decoding 'Birds in the City': A Board Game For Engaging With Urban Nature
description:
Can games be a tool for public engagement with nature?

Join us to play Birds in the City: Bengaluru Edition, a board game designed to explore bird diversity and ecological change in urban areas. Created through a research-driven, iterative design process, the game can be used as an educational tool for sparking dialogue about wildlife in cities like Bengaluru.

This workshop invites you to experience the game firsthand and hear from the creators at ‘Play in Nature’ about how they blended research, design, and storytelling to create this game. Join us to explore how serious games can be designed to support environmental awareness and learning.
